channel.title: Fix It on DIYDeveloper.io
channel.description: Recent content in Fix It on DIYDeveloper.io

item.title: How to replace your exhaust fan
item.description: Is your old exhaust fan too noisy? does it let cold air through from your ceiling cavity? Exhaust fans are easy to replace. I’ll show you how.

item.title: How to plane a door
item.description: Is your cupboard (or other) door scraping against the frame? All you need to fix it is a power plane (the type with a blade, not wings).

item.title: How to replace glass door rollers
item.description: Don’t let a scraping, dragging door ruin your day. Let’s replace the rollers!

item.title: Child proofing my TV
item.description: Kids destroy your expensive TV? Your $1700 TV? Good news dear reader. I’ve found a way to stop it happening again.

item.title: Fix Dry Wall Surface
item.description: If you’ve tried ripping anything off drywall (like Tiles for instance), you’ve probably notice a problem. It utterly destroys the surface of the drywall. It is fairly easy to fix.

item.title: Replace an old dome skylight
item.description: I’m going to show you how to replace your old acrylic dome skylight. It sure beats a hole in the roof… unless you want a hole in your roof.

item.title: Replace your Nexus 4 screen
item.description:
The Nexus4 is a great phone. Unfortunately it is a little bit fragile. I fell asleep with my N4 in my pocket… woke up, and the back had a crack. My wife dropped her N4 and the screen shattered.

I’m going to walk you through how to fix it.

item.title: Replacing a toilet cistern
item.description:
Have you ever seen just how curious a 4 year old can be? My 4 year old wondered what was under the impossible-to-replace vitreous china Cistern lid. As a result, I needed a new cistern lid (my 4 year old survived unscathed).

Turns out that you can’t buy a Cistern lid in Brisbane, so read on and learn how to replace the entire toilet cistern…

item.title: Installing a new bathroom basin
item.description:
When I moved into my house 2 years ago, it had one glaring problem…. a strip of rust around the front of the bathroom basin. Because I’m not the best at prioritising things (and there happened to be some great sales on Steam, and I have 2 young kids, etc etc), my solution was to put a piece of white duct tape over it for 2 years and get on with my life.

I happened to impulse buy a sink a few weeks ago (I had the old sink measurements saved on my phone!), I decided to have a go at installing it.

item.title: Replacing a shower head
item.description:
A bad shower head is more annoying than you might think. It’s something we use every day, but it amazes me how many people will put up with a rubbish shower head for years. You wouldn’t put up with a crappy text editor for that long, would you?

It takes 10 minutes to replace, so lets get started!
